p: Some local medical systems in Northeast Brazil also carry a strong influence of African cultural matrices, due to a regime of slavery that brought Africans to the country, but especially to that region ( Albuquerque, 2014). It should be noted that Albuquerque (2011) investigated cases of substitution of medicinal species of the same genus, Ocimum L. (Lamiaceae), carried out by Africans when they arrived in Brazil, and concluded that the substitution process obeyed morphological similarities, namely plant, type of inflorescence and fruit ( Albuquerque, 2011). In addition, pharmacological studies demonstrate that many of these substitute species have the same biological activity observed for African medicinal species of this genus ( Albuquerque, 2011). Therefore, utilitarian equivalence cases may be related to both historical knowledge of a past social group and chemical similarities between equivalent plants.
